title: Yaya Bey, Rosali, Font, and More Playing Abortion Access Benefit Concerts
description: Surfbort, Draag, Guerilla Toss, Dazy, Mamalarky, and Omni are also among the bands playing Noise for Now benefit shows in various U.S. cities
author: Jazz Monroe
excerpt: Surfbort, Draag, Guerilla Toss, Dazy, Mamalarky, and Omni are also among the bands playing Noise for Now benefit shows in various U.S. cities
text: Yaya Bey, Rosali, and Font are among the bands playing abortion access benefit concerts across the United States on Saturday, January 25, 2025. Proceeds from the shows go to Noise for Now. Organized by Ground Control Touring, the series takes place in Los Angeles, New York, Chicago, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Austin, Raleigh, and Washington, D.C., with a different lineup in each city.Guerilla Toss, Dazegxd, and Gift are among those on the New York bill; Yaya Bey will play in Washington, D.C.; Rosali in Raleigh, North Carolina; and Font in their native Austin, Texas. Cities across the country will host bands including Surfbort, Draag, Dazy, Mamalarky, Omni, Owen, and Tim Kinsella & Jenny Pulse. Check out the full schedule on the poster below.Back in March, Noise for Now put together the second volume of its compilation series benefitting independent abortion providers. Faye Webster, David Byrne, and the War on Drugs were among those to contribute.
html:
Yaya Bey, Rosali, and Font are among the bands playing abortion access benefit concerts across the United States on Saturday, January 25, 2025. Proceeds from the shows go to Noise for Now. Organized by Ground Control Touring, the series takes place in Los Angeles, New York, Chicago, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Austin, Raleigh, and Washington, D.C., with a different lineup in each city.

Guerilla Toss, Dazegxd, and Gift are among those on the New York bill; Yaya Bey will play in Washington, D.C.; Rosali in Raleigh, North Carolina; and Font in their native Austin, Texas. Cities across the country will host bands including Surfbort, Draag, Dazy, Mamalarky, Omni, Owen, and Tim Kinsella & Jenny Pulse. Check out the full schedule on the poster below.

Back in March, Noise for Now put together the second volume of its compilation series benefitting independent abortion providers. Faye Webster, David Byrne, and the War on Drugs were among those to contribute.
